hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 10-day ATR compression to <1.5% of price, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band with >2x average volume signals a transition to BULL regime with 85% probability over next 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility periods in neutral regimes often precede directional breaks. Volume-confirmed breakouts from compression patterns have historically signaled regime shifts as institutional flows re-enter. Current MiCA regulatory clarity may reduce uncertainty, allowing capital deployment.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes >20-day BB upper band (2 std)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% gain from entry OR regime shifts to BULL with confidence >75%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes back inside BB bands AND volume <50% of breakout day
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days without regime transition confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such breakouts (2018-2024) fail to sustain >3 days OR lead to bear regime instead of bull.
